comments.commentBody: The games have become so boring along with the boorish players. I guess the players feel they have to do something to give a little spark to the game. The same old plays, poor to nonexistent tackles/blocking, poor sportsmanship and cheap shots to the head do not make for an enjoyable game.
Football players used act like warriors, but now they act like court jesters and fools.
One is (unfortunately) protected by the First Amendment.

I Think the officials should worry more about affecting the outcome of games with their incompetency..Atl vs Sea..no iterference...Pit vs Mia..no horsecollar...etc..rather than running around worrying about celebrations...If they did their jobs...maybe Atlanta and Pittsburgh could celebrate..instead of dealing with losses..handed out by unqualified..or uninterested officials
... or delay the ever exciting extra point try

Not very logical. No one is ennobling anyone, rather you are denigrating someone. The point that seems to have escaped you is if an athlete is famous and well-paid because of a skill, they should only be penalized financially if their skill diminishes. If the pay is not based on politics the athlete should be free to exercise free speech without the label of grandstanding. To conflate athletic performance with patriotism is frankly Trumpish. I hope you get over being tired.

Both work together.  A celebrity can draw attention to the cause, inspiring people to donate or volunteer or speak up.  I don't mean in a "hey, I want to be like Colin and Martina" way, but in a "hey, it's actually possible to speak out about this" way.  Sort of like the women who were spurred by Trump's crass remarks and behavior to speak up about past indignities.

Professional athletes get paid for performance, period. Parents should teach children that athletes are just like everyone else outside of their sport. Good guys, inspirations, jerks, goons, bad guys, wife beaters, and everything in between. Pick the athletes you idolize with care; chances are you'll be disappointed. In the meantime the real hero is right under your nose; the old man or mom suiting up for work every single and making monthly mortgage payment for 30 years. That's a hero.

But remember, homophobia was considered a good thing by most people back then (unlike anti-Semitism). She was instrumental in changing public perceptions of what being gay meant --- comparable to the way Magic Johnson affected public perceptions of people with HIV.

Also, she didn't renounce her Czech citizenship --- the Czech government revoked it.

Globalization is skewing everything....outsourcing, insourcing.....whatever you want to call it.  Then theres's automation.  No job security whatsoever.  Assets are being bid up because people in foreign markets who made money via globalization are transferring money here, bidding up real estate and other assets.  I'd like to see a study done on the equity markets to see how many companies are currently listed on the U.S. exchanges, and how that's changed over the last 20-30 years.  How many more people are investing than in the past to bid up prices/market caps and how have P/E ratios may have changed.  I don't follow the markets and individual companies as closely as I used to when I was an analyst, but my understanding is now we are also seeing a lot more evidence than in the past of companies appearing to have EPS growth that is manipulated by share buybacks or some other factor, which is deceiving because it isn't growing a company organically.  With a low interest rate environment, money is naturally going to flow into equity markets, private equity, alternative asset classes, foreign markets (although risky - lot of countries slowing down and not as transparent as need be without following GAAP).  Lots of hedge funds closing shop.  Sign of the times.  Need to come up with a more sustainable economic model.  If you saw "Madoff," starring Richard Dreyfuss.  When he gets arrested for his Ponzi scheme, he comments that our whole system is a Ponzi scheme, and he's right.
"humbly?"  You are indeed joking!

Senator McCain announces publicly that if Clinton wins the Senate will work to block anyone she nominates for the SCOTUS.

Is that really a person Arizonans want representing them?

McCain has shown that he hasn't a shred of integrity left. The headline the day after election day should read:

"Bitter Old Obstructionist Returns to Senate"
Haha, the last stand of freedom. It's so embarrassing to listen to the rubes try to talk about issues. Like freedom.

"when you have a problem, throw money at it."

Be sure to thank the GOP justices for Citizens United.

...Andrew
Donald J. Trump's intellectual level is the same as the intellectual level of that cardiologist that will try to correct a case of aortic dissection with a cataplasm.
Tim, you must be way, way out on Long Island, maybe on The Sound.
You don't understand. The GOP is defending your rights to freedom.
And thank one another for destroying the US.
Are you suggesting McCain should be arrested? I wouldn't mind that.

'And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.' King James Bible, Genesis

'Now, in the other mythologies, one puts oneself in accord with the world. If the world is a mixture of good and evil, you do not put yourself in accord with it. You identify with the good and you fight against the evil, and this is a religious system which belongs to the Near East, following Zarathustra’s time. It’s in the biblical tradition, all the way, in Christianity and in Islam as well. This business of not being with nature, and we speak with sort of derogation of “the nature religions.” You see, with that fall in the garden [of Eden], nature was regarded as corrupt. There’s a myth for you that corrupts the whole world for us. And every spontaneous act is sinful, because nature is corrupt and has to be corrected, must not be yielded to. You get a totally different civilization, a totally different way of living according to your myth as to whether nature is fallen or whether nature is itself a manifestation of divinity, and the spirit being the revelation of the divinity that’s inherent in nature.'

http://billmoyers.com/content/ep-2-joseph-campbell-and-the-power-of-myth...
@Doug1000,deplorable comment from one who supports a candidate who has done deplorable acts!
At last!  Something to like about the Republicans!
Respect for the Constitution, the borders, and the freedom of the people is extremist? OK...
Clinton peddles feminism like its women working in parallel but everyone surmises she has a more private approach. Money helps.

If you examine the leaked emails and carefully examine my premise, you too may come to the conclusion that Hillary Clinton is not much of a feminist. Having read a few of the emails where she discusses China, they seem reasonable enough. She talks about balance of power, etc.

But at her core, she is a loyal servant of power. And apparently an effective one. What does that mean? It means that primarily, she does the bidding of those in power—older wealthy capitalistic,white men. Men on a power trip that doesn’t consider anything but leveraging their power over the world and ignoring most basic human considerations. Men of the New American Century, and also Democrats like Obama and Kerry.

Is this what feminists are admiring in her? I’d like to hear answers to my question.

"Not one bit of proof has been produced that she is corrupt."

This despite millions of dollars wasted in pointless and partisan investigations. On the other side, we've not even seen Trump's taxes. Even if we ignore the massive "pants on fire" ratings he earns, we all need to wonder what he's still hiding in those mysterious tax returns.

...Andrew
